channel.title: Beat the Clock Special Video Edition
channel.description:
Time to Beat the Clock!
I'm going on vacation so this edition will be a bit different. Here's the challenge:
- Create a tutorial video using the new screen recording feature in iOS 11 ([here's how it works](https://www.macrumors.com/how-to/record-iphone-ipad-screen-ios-11/)). - The theme is "Tips & Tricks", which means you have to show some trick that you think is useful when making music. Like how to make a good bass line or get your drums to stand out. - You can add a voice-over and/or captions if you want. Keep things simple though! - Max video length is 5 minutes. - Upload your video to YouTube and name it: "Auxy Tips: _what you're showing_" - Post the link to your video here. - We'll pick our favorites on Monday 2 October, so you have 10 days to finish. - We'll feature the best videos and the top 3 winners will get an epic [Auxy t-shirt](https://cottonbureau.com/products/auxy) when we do the next print round.
We're super excited to see how this turns out. Good luck!

item.title: Beat the Clock Special Video Edition
item.dc:creator: LittleSpikes
item.description:
I made a track with winning tips below and I think it is better than ever! Thanks for users who make the tutorial video!
-what I used are
•intensifying drumbeat for build (by Andrew Adams)
•white noise (by Zeph)
•offbeat bass sound and basically every sounds he recommends ( by Southborne)
-my track is https://soundcloud.com/user-186311006/jungri-la

item.source: Beat the Clock Special Video Edition

item.title: Beat the Clock Special Video Edition
item.dc:creator: DJ_La_Rocca
item.description:
Dude that was the most sickest drop ever! I’ve actually been a big fan of Melbourne bounce and have been tryna producers it for ages I’ve been waiting so long for a Melbourne bounce pack to come out. The original auxy I used to use “shade” then once the packs came out I’d use “purr” “slope” and “gravel” I’ve been using the sound “gossip” for ages but I didn’t know u could use a bass as a lead. Thank u so much now I’ll be able to get back into Melbourne bounce!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Beat the Clock Special Video Edition
item.dc:creator: Alyen
item.description:
That chord progressions came about awhile back. I came up while jamming out on the piano one day. Since that day I’ve been looking for where it’s from(I’m assuming I’ve subconsciously picked it up from somewhere). Haven’t found where, I even tried Shazam.
Still wouldn’t be a bad idea to make a video on how I come up with chord progressions.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
Some great tips here.

I’m wondering if people would be interested in tutorials covering mixing/mastering in other programs?
Perhaps using free iOS apps like Garageband?

Is anybody using other apps or are you doing everything in Auxy?

item.title: Beat the Clock Special Video Edition
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
Also, don’t overlook things that would be interesting for beginners. Doesn’t have to be about pro tips, but could just be about picking good sounds, making basic beats, etc. I think those would be really popular and something we’d love to see more of.
